jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As the Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for building early commercial traction ahead of product launch. You will identify high-value markets, establish relationships with leading organizations in scientific and industrial computing, and help shape the go-to-market strategy.

This role combines strategic insight, technical curiosity, and sales acumen — ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of advanced technology and business growth.

Key Responsibilities

  • Market Development: Identify and prioritize market segments and customer profiles where our silicon platform offers the most value (e.g., energy, finance, materials, climate, or AI research).

  • Customer Outreach: Engage early adopters, research institutions, and industrial partners to validate product-market fit and secure pre-launch commitments or letters of intent (LOIs).

  • Pipeline Management: Develop and maintain a robust sales pipeline leading up to launch.

  • Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align product positioning, pricing, and launch strategies with market demand.

  • Partnerships: Identify strategic partnerships (software vendors, integrators, or OEMs) that can accelerate adoption.

  • Feedback Loop: Translate customer feedback into actionable insights for product and marketing teams.

  • Thought Leadership: Represent the company at conferences, technical symposia, and partner events to build credibility in the scientific computing community.

Qualifications

Required:

  • 5+ years of experience in business development, partnerships, or enterprise sales, ideally in semiconductors, HPC, AI hardware, or scientific computing.

  • Strong understanding of the scientific and high-performance computing ecosystem (e.g., HPC centers, national labs, simulation workloads).

  • Demonstrated ability to develop relationships with technical decision-makers.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex technology into business value.

  • Entrepreneurial mindset — comfortable operating in an early-stage environment.

Preferred:

  • Technical background (e.g., in computer engineering, physics, or applied mathematics).

  • Experience bringing new hardware or deep-tech products to market.

  • Existing network in HPC or research computing communities.

  • Experience with pre-launch customer engagement, pilot programs, or early-access partnerships.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to join a cutting-edge hardware startup redefining scientific computing.

  • Competitive compensation and equity package.

  • Direct impact on product strategy and early customer success.

  • Collaborative, high-velocity work environment.

As passionate scientists and engineers, we are well aware of the plethora of critical problems in the world that cannot be solved because humanity simply does not have enough computing power. To address this, Vorticity is developing a radically new silicon chip architecture and system to dramatically accelerate scientific computing problems.

Vorticity’s mission is to expand human ingenuity. To do that we are building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer – Experienced (3–5 Years)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As a Software Engineer at Vorticity, you will work at the intersection of scientific computing and modern web technologies. You’ll be responsible for developing robust platform infrastructure, integrating high-performance computation backends, and creating seamless user experiences for our scientific community. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in technical depth, enjoys working across the stack, and wants to make an impact in scientific innovation.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain our scientific platforms, and integrate them with our high-performance computation backend.

  • Understand user requirements to improve the platform experience, including scientific workflows.

  • Develop and maintain backend services to manage and integrate complex data streams.

  • Deploy, monitor, and optimize our platform infrastructure using container orchestration and cloud technologies.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in a software engineering role.

  • Strong proficiency in Java Script, React, Python and Docker.

  • Experience with database design.

  • Experience with Kubernetes and AWS.

  • Ability to operate at multiple levels of abstraction in a complex software system.

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related. educational background.

  • Experience working on large full-stack projects.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with Networking.

  • Experience with Frontend Development.

  • Experience with CI/CD.

To address this, Vorticity is developing a radically new silicon chip architecture and system to dramatically accelerate scientific computing problems.

Vorticity’s mission is to expand human ingenuity. To do that we are building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Scientific Computing - New Grad
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As a core software developer, you will directly impact how scientific computing applications are executed on CPUs, GPUs to our own hardware. In this position, you will develop software for compilation, optimization, execution, acceleration, debugging, profiling, and/or integration of scientific computing applications.

Responsibilities

  • Develop software in C++, CUDA or Python to optimize, compile, and/or execute scientific computing applications and numerical solutions to complex partial differential equations.

  • Measure, analyze, debug, and improve the software stack that supports these models

  • Integrate and deploy successful improvements into production software releases and to customers

Requirements

  • Strong proficiency in C/C++, CUDA and Python

  • Ability to operate at multiple levels of abstraction in a complex software system

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related educational background. * Positions are available at all levels of seniority

Preferred Skills

  • Familiarity with scientific computing methods (e.g. Finite difference, Monte Carlo, FFT)

  • Strong knowledge of computer science fundamentals

As passionate scientists and engineers, we are well aware of the plethora of critical problems in the world that cannot be solved because humanity simply does not have enough computing power. To address this, Vorticity is developing a radically new silicon chip architecture and system to dramatically accelerate scientific computing problems.

Vorticity’s mission is to expand human ingenuity. To do that we are building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

jobs.title: Compiler Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We're building a new class of Scientific Processing Units (SPUs) to push the boundaries of high-performance computing. As a Compiler Engineer, you'll extend our full-stack LLVM-based compiler and create the software magic that makes scientific applications run seamlessly on our hardware.

This is not an easy role. It requires passion for understanding how hardware and software work together, the ability to wear multiple hats across the software stack, strong communication skills, a lot of patience, and, most importantly, zero ego.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and extend Vorticity’s compiler backend, mapping LLVM IR to our proprietary ISA.

  • Build and maintain different compiler frontends (C/C++, MLIR, and others) to map custom kernels to our first-generation SPU.

  • Create low-level runtime libraries to program and control SPUs, scaling to multi-host and multi-SPU systems.

  • Participate in iterative optimization loops for our low-level kernel libraries.

  • Lay the groundwork for integration with high-level software frameworks (PyTorch, Triton and others).

  • Identify opportunities to improve compilation flow, hardware utilization, and system efficiency.

  • Collaborate with architecture and performance teams to analyze bottlenecks and co-design innovative software and hardware solutions.

  • Write clear, concise technical documentation for Vorticity’s kernel engineers and customers.

  • Stay up to date with advancements in compilers, programming models, and computer architecture.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.

  • Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.

  • 5+ years of experience in modern C++ (LLVM IR experience strongly preferred). Exceptional candidates with fewer years but strong skills are also welcome.

  • Background in high-performance computing or parallel programming.

  • Deep understanding of computer architecture and compiler frameworks.

  • Proficiency in C, C++, Python and development on Linux. Shell scripting, CUDA C++ are a plus.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Strong ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.

  • Willingness to put in the hard work needed to bring our SPU to life.

  • Above all: zero ego.

As passionate scientists and engineers, we are well aware of the plethora of critical problems in the world that cannot be solved because humanity simply does not have enough computing power. To address this, Vorticity is developing a radically new silicon chip architecture and system to dramatically accelerate scientific computing problems.

Vorticity’s mission is to expand human ingenuity. To do that we are building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!
